intro: Humboltia rubens, commonly known as the red-tailed nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. Humboltia rubens is known for its toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals.
